intro: Mohria saxatilis, commonly known as the rock mohr, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or mountainous areas. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a strong, spicy scent when crushed. Mohria saxatilis is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
